name: Humanitarian Operations
description:
We are in the process of developing a digital game that is free to play with no in-game purchases which will raise money for Humanitarian Operations.

Humanitarian Operations is now branching into our second mission; to eradicate educational inequality. We aim to make education widely available to every child in the world, regardless of their background or location, and without prejudice. 

We are growing our team and looking for like-minded individuals to bring their skills to push our mission forward. We value teamwork, honesty, and flexibility in the workplace and creating an environment for each individual to flourish is of the utmost importance to us.

jobs.title: Animator
jobs.description:
Junior Animation CGI / 3D / Digital / Design

Graduate or 1 year’s experience
Located in Liverpool Street, with great transport link from the Greater London area
Animation / CGI / 3D / Digital / Design
WHO ARE WE?

Humanitarian Operations – (HOPE) is a 'First Responder Disaster Relief Agency' established on September 1st, 2004, when the Bahamian Government became overwhelmed by the disaster and destruction caused by Hurricane Frances.

At the end of 2018, many of those involved sought approval to establish a charitable organisation that would be free to assist on a needs-assessed basis - in line with the principles established by the United Nations.

Humanitarian Operations has now had to effectively start from scratch - with the only asset retained being the invaluable experience held by those that have remained in place to continue the efforts that help so many lives. The team has operated and provided much needed assistance in every major disaster location since its formation, including: the Haitian Earthquake, the Indian Ocean Tsunami, Hurricane Katrina and the floods in India. It is impossible to quantify the number of lives that have been saved.

WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING?

Working alongside our Gaming Director you will be animating characters and creatures, ensuring that the animation is completed and delivered on time, to the agreed quality standards.

WE NEED YOU TO HAVE…

Degree or qualification in 3d Animation
Solid experience in Autodesk Maya
Knowledge of Unity
Organisation and attention to detail/accuracy
At ease with working in a diverse and fast paced setting
Knowledge of different video file formats and understanding of Lighting, Texturing, Modelling and Rendering
Passion, determination and energy to excel in the motion graphics industry
Demonstrate knowledge of timing, posing, acting and storytelling techniques.
Ability to perform visual and analytical problem solving in 3-dimensional space, including the ability to accurately interpret 3D layouts and analyse 3D form.
Well versed in the principles of animation
Understanding of animation pipeline.
Ability to troubleshoot and problem solve.
About You

Ability to work well in a team environment.
Highly motivated.
Adaptable.
Must communicate well and be able to take notes and direction
About the Position

. The position is currently Unpaid Intern Position for the next 8 weeks (2 months) with the expectation of Full Time Job paid on the Avg. London wage standards for the successful candidate. You will be working in a young and friendly environment, where there is always great margin for growth and learn new skills.

Job Type: Internship

jobs.title: Unity Developer
jobs.description:
THE COMPANY

Humanitarian Operations – (HOPE) is a 'First Responder Disaster Relief Agency' established on September 1st, 2004, when the Bahamian Government became overwhelmed by the disaster and destruction caused by Hurricane Frances.

At the end of 2018, many of those involved sought approval to establish a charitable organisation that would be free to assist on a needs-assessed basis - in line with the principles established by the United Nations.

Humanitarian Operations has now had to effectively start from scratch - with the only asset retained being the invaluable experience held by those that have remained in place to continue the efforts that help so many lives. The team has operated and provided much needed assistance in every major disaster location since its formation, including: the Haitian Earthquake, the Indian Ocean Tsunami, Hurricane Katrina and the floods in India. It is impossible to quantify the number of lives that have been saved.

At Humanitarian Operations, we are developing a prototype “city style” game in Unity to fund our disaster relief operations globally. The new Unity Designer/Developer will develop the current Unity project and be responsible for bringing new digital user experiences onto the rig, for research, test and sales purposes.

Your role includes:

Working with the art department to insert assets into Unity
Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable code
Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications
Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to address and mitigate these problems
Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization
Preparing the product for Demo Days and customer visits.
Develop, test, document and deploy robust and scalable solutions
About You

You will stop at nothing until the game is simple and delightful to use. You are a Unity die-hard who loves to find new assets and ways to optimise and increase reality of the world and experiences within it and how to optimise your code to prevent jitter.

Your background might include:

Several years’ experience working as a Unity designer/developer either for conceptual or commercial projects games, 2D interfaces or 3D interfaces, either in-house or in an agency
Unity developers with AR/VR experience will be strongly considered.
Excellent knowledge of Visual Studio, Unity, C#, Mobile Experience (iOS, Android)
Experience of using Unity, including experience with scripting
Strong understanding of object-oriented programming
Knack for writing clean, readable, and easily maintainable code
Knowledge of code versioning tools
Personal qualities that will help you succeed in this role include:

Excellent interpersonal skills, confident, professional and able to negotiate positive outcomes with clients and staff when required
Ability to work on own initiative, but also seek assistance when required
Demonstrate pride in their work, through high quality and accurate timely delivery
Ability to work collaboratively with others to form strong positive working relationships
Ability to organise and prioritise workload to ensure timescales are met
Willingness to develop personal skills and basic knowledge in other disciplines
Willingness to share knowledge and help junior team members develop
Volunteers are encouraged to take advantage of and benefit from :

Flexible working hours
Personal and professional development
A challenging role within a performance based culture in which you will be surrounded by dynamic, entrepreneurially minded colleagues.
Job Type: Internship
